p: In most cases COVID-19 presents mild symptoms, and 50% of infected individuals are asymptomatic [ 2]. However, in about 20% of patients the disease causes severe clinical consequences that require hospitalization and, in some cases, intensive care [ 3]. The average time between the onset of symptoms and hospitalization is seven days [ 4]. These data confirm the clinical observation that patients with severe forms worsen to clinical conditions one week after the onset of symptoms, on average [ 5]. Individual factors influencing the natural history of the disease could cause such dissimilar clinical outcomes.
